intro: Zaluzianskya rubrostellata, commonly known as the red-stemmed zonal plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and adaptability to arid conditions make it a notable species in botanical collections.
